business.name: The Smart Sensory
business.mission: Sensory integration challenges, inclusive spaces, early intervention for children

monthly_revenue.note: Last year 'not very great' financially. Keren on maternity leave contributed to that

maternity_leave_impact.duration: Recent (child now almost 2 years old, born ~Sept 2023)
maternity_leave_impact.current_status: Works with daughter 'around the clock in the office, at home'

funding_status.recent_fundraising: Have NOT been keen for funding this year
funding_status.reason: Needed to streamline and put structures in place. Found loopholes while Keren was away
funding_status.future_plans: Start fundraising from next year for manufacturing plant expansion

manufacturing_plan.current: Manufacturing exists but not fully running

mission_pivot_early_intervention.label: strategic_adaptation
evidence: Initially focused on sensory integration challenges
Market research revealed early intervention is MORE urgent problem
Now including caregivers training + community outreach
Widened activities but stayed on mission

bloom_humenow_experience.label: very_positive_empowering
evidence: 'Experience with Bloom was very, very empowering'
Uses Bloom as 'comparison point' for evaluating other programs

work_life_balance_with_baby.label: challenged_managing
evidence: Works with daughter Merkel 'around the clock in the office, at home'
Daughter is 'quite feisty and very demanding and very pushy'
Bilal: 'All power to all women who try to figure out working and caretaking'

rama_impact_mentorship.label: grateful_well_supported
evidence: Found mentors through Rama Impact (founded by Tamara from HumeNow)
Mentors: Communication, business strategy/scale (5 years), financial strategy, sustainability
Working with mentors as they fundraise

fraud_application_experience.label: scared_skeptical
evidence: Applied for 'EU funding', got accepted, discovered it was FRAUD
'We're a bit scared and skeptical now. We really scrutinize everything'
Thankfully developer caught it before sharing bank details

explicit_needs.evidence: Hoping to start fundraising from next year, mainly to expand manufactured plan so that fully running unit
explicit_needs.willingness_to_pay: Seeking grants or revenue share models

explicit_needs.evidence: Interested in Kuwa program (Kenya): revenue share funding where 'we fund you, take percentage of revenue to fund next enterprise'
explicit_needs.note: Prefers accountability model over traditional grants

implied_needs.inference: Working around the clock with daughter present. Challenging to focus. Needs childcare or flexible work arrangements
While she was on maternity leave, discovered 'loopholes' in operations. Needed to 'streamline and put structures in place'

core_values.evidence: Pivoted to focus on early intervention after market research. 'Problem more urgent than what you're trying to solve.' Now training caregivers to identify early
Would present on 'inclusive spaces and what that really means to every human being. Sensory inclusive spaces and what that means'
Mentor for sustainability: 'Creating a lot of waste, then how do we recycle that waste and make it purposeful?'
On revenue share: 'Give me funds but make me accountable. Not only numbers but growth projections. Share financial books. You remain very accountable'

interest_level.label: likely_interested_accountability_focused
interest_level.note: Not explicitly discussed but values suggest alignment
interest_level.inference: Loves accountability + revenue share models. Community connections important (HumeNow, Rama Impact, Linda partnership)

most_valuable: Benchmark quality: 'You always want to equate or acclimatize the problem to what Bloom offered'
Community connections (still in touch with Enum wellness coach, Linda fashion upcycling, Maro)
what_worked: Monthly wellness check-ins with Enum (mental health, work-life balance)
Partnership with Linda (caregivers training + fashion upcycling collaboration)
design_suggestions: Annual alumni conference (like Africa Entrepreneurship Corporation model)
Refund travel costs for attendance proof
Scaling mentorship opportunity for mid-stage entrepreneurs

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong mission clarity, strategic pivot based on market research, well-supported by mentors (Rama Impact). BUT: Challenging financial year, work-life balance stressed (new mother working around clock), operational structures being fixed. Good candidate once structures in place and fundraising begins (2025). Risk: bandwidth with childcare. Strength: Accountability mindset, partnership experience (Linda collaboration).

support_needed: Revenue share funding model exploration (Kuwa program)
Fraud protection education (after EU scam experience)
recommendation.unique_value: HealthTech early intervention, sensory integration expertise, Kenya representation, women entrepreneurship + motherhood, partnership experience (Linda collaboration), accountability mindset
recommendation.special_note: Keren sees Bloom as benchmark quality. Any alumni program design should consult her on what 'empowering' looks like.

linda_collaboration_early_intervention_u.description: Keren (Smart Sensory) + Linda (fashion upcycling, women employment) collaborating on caregivers training + empowerment project

specifics.linda_brings: Fashion upcycling, women upskilling for employment
specifics.overlap: Train same mothers Linda works with on early intervention
specifics.status: In planning phase, met in person last week (Kenya-based)
specifics.next_steps: Define metrics, objectives, how to move forward

linda_collaboration_early_intervention_u.action_required: Bilal offers support/facilitation for this Bloom alumni partnership. Could showcase as alumni collaboration success story

kuwa_revenue_share_model.description: Kuwa (Kenya program, 'grow' in Swahili): Revenue share funding model. 'We fund you, take revenue percentage to fund next enterprise'
kuwa_revenue_share_model.appeal_to_keren: Accountability + transparency. Share financial books throughout agreement. Investor can advise if seeing problems
kuwa_revenue_share_model.comparison: Like 'slow burnerator' vs accelerator - longer touch points, continuous monitoring
kuwa_revenue_share_model.action_required: Bilal researches Kuwa model, considers adapting for Bloom cooperative

bloom_alumni_conference_refund_model.description: Africa Entrepreneurship Corporation: Annual conference in each country. Alumni spend own money to attend, get refunded at end with proof of attendance

benefits.verification: Proof of attendance required for refund

bloom_alumni_conference_refund_model.keren_would_present: Inclusive spaces and sensory integration for human wellbeing (general + entrepreneurship)
bloom_alumni_conference_refund_model.action_required: Bilal considers this model for Bloom alumni gatherings

keren_as_scaling_mentor.description: Keren offered to mentor next-stage entrepreneurs on: 'Strategies of scaling. When is the right time to scale?'

expertise.experience: 3 years post-HumeNow, navigated maternity + business, operational challenges, manufacturing plans

keren_as_scaling_mentor.action_required: Connect Keren with entrepreneurs at scaling decision point

key_quotes.on_bloom_quality: The experience with Bloom was very, very empowering and you always want to equate or acclimatize the problem to what Bloom offered. That has been the comparison point for me personally
key_quotes.on_market_research_pivot: We realized there's one problem that is more urgent than what you're trying to solve. So that was a little bit changed our goal, but it's still on track because it was not a far fetched problem
key_quotes.on_revenue_share_accountability: I would prefer that you give me the funds, but make me accountable for that fund. Not only by giving you the numbers, but yes this is the growth, this is the projections. And I give a little bit of that back
key_quotes.on_work_life_balance: I work with her around the clock in the office, at home. So she's quite feisty and very demanding and very pushy
key_quotes.on_fraud_experience: We're a bit scared and skeptical now. We really scrutinize everything
key_quotes.on_what_to_present: I would like to share about sensory inclusive spaces and what that means to human beings... talk more generally on the well being and also child development
key_quotes.on_mentorship_offer: I would like to talk to entrepreneurs about strategies of scaling. When is the right time to scale?

strengths: Strategic pivot based on market research
meta_insights.unique_contribution: HealthTech early intervention specialist, sensory integration, Kenya representation, mother entrepreneur, accountability advocate, alumni partnership model (with Linda), scaling mentorship potential
